org.zoolu.tools
Class Timer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.zoolu.tools.Timer
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.zoolu.tools.InnerTimerListener
public class Timer
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.zoolu.tools.InnerTimerListener

A Timer is a simple object that fires an onTimeout() method to its TimerListener when the time expires. A Timer have to be started and can be halted before expired.

Field Summary
static boolean SINGLE_THREAD
          Whether using single thread for all timer instances.
 
Constructor Summary
Timer(long t_msec, java.lang.String t_label, TimerListener t_listener)
          Creates a new Timer of msec milliseconds, with a label t_event, and with TimerListener listener The Timer is not started.
Timer(long t_msec, TimerListener t_listener)
          Creates a new Timer of msec milliseconds with TimerListener listener The Timer is not started.
 
Method Summary

          Gets the Timer label.

          Gets the initial time (in milliseconds).

          Stops the Timer.

Constructor Detail

Timer

public Timer(long t_msec,
             TimerListener t_listener)
Creates a new Timer of msec milliseconds with TimerListener listener The Timer is not started. You need to fire the start() method.
